name: Earth
text: Earth surface is defined here as a 510 065 605 km²
plane with aspect ratio of 1:√2. This is the same
ratio that is used in the ISO 216 paper size
standard (the series "A", "B" and "C").
510 065 605 km² can be represented as a 18 991 ×
26 858 km rectangle. Turned into millimeters and
rounded to the nearest integrer, it define the
first format named Γ0 after the first character of
Gaïa in greek (Γαία).
This format has a width of 18 991 455 186 mm and a
height of 26 857 973 494 mm.
This first approximation with a millimeter
precision result in an error of a missing
1923.153920 m² surface.
This catalog presents on each page the folded
format of the previous page format until we reach
the first format that can be filled in a A4 which
is the number 53 (a Γ0 folded in half by its
larger side 53 times). The Γ53 is printed here at
its real scale, the size of this catalog.
